snippet: The authorities charged Johann Breyer was complicit in the gassing of 216,000 Jews brought to Auschwitz in 1944 from Hungary, Czechoslovakia and Germany.
abstract: German authorities are seeking to extradite 89-year-old Johann Breyer, Philadephia resident who is accused of complicity in the gassing of 216,00 Jews during his time as a guard at the Auschwitz concentration camp; Breyer is arrested and held as proceedings continue; case signals new cooperation between Germany and the United States in prosecuting people suspected of having been Nazis.

byline.contributor: Jon Hurdle contributed reporting from Philadelphia.

lead_paragraph: The authorities charged Johann Breyer was complicit in the gassing of 216,000 Jews brought to Auschwitz in 1944 from Hungary, Czechoslovakia and Germany.

headline.main: A Retiree, 89, Is Held in Deaths at Auschwitz
headline.print_headline: Retiree, 89, Held for Trial Over Auschwitz Deaths

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
